description: Dive into "Mae Rim Mall Adventures Await" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Mae Rim Mall Adventures Await

places.generalDescription: One Nimman is a modern marketplace located in Chiang Mai, offering a vibrant mix of retail shops, cafes, and food stalls. The first floor and the third and fourth floors house an arts, culture, and lifestyle living space that seamlessly blends modern architecture with local Chiang Mai culture. Lets Relax Chiang Mai One Nimman provides a serene spa experience within this lively environment. The complex also features European architectural influences that perfectly complement its myriad of shops, restaurants, cafes, and art galleries.

sources.snippet: One Nimman is a brand-new lifestyle mall concept in Chiang Mai; located in the hip and trendy Nimmanhaemin neighbourhood. There are numerous establishments found within the complex including shops, art and...

places.name: One Nimman

reviews.text:
A cool place to hang out! The architecture looks great, and the vibe is modern but cozy. There are lots of cute shops, cafes, and little art spaces to explore.

I even found a wine tasting and got to try 6 glasses for just 300 Baht! Definitely made the experience even better.

It's a nice spot to wander around. Totally worth a visit if you're in Chiang Mai!

I honestly don't have enough videos to show how cool this market center is. so modern and hip with lots of food options and shopping. Lots of times there are performances and little markets around or in the middle. In one of my photos i saw this amazing meat stand and i got the ribs and it was insane how good it was.
Very cute place to bring a date and walk around. Tons of options and it's definitely kid friendly.

One Nimman is a vibrant mix of modern European-style architecture and Chiang Mai charm. The open market area is lively and full of unique shops, local crafts, and stylish boutiques, making it a great place to wander and discover something new. The food court offers a wide range of delicious options - from local Thai street food to international flavors - all in a clean and inviting setting. The open-air design, cobblestone walkways, and clock tower create a beautiful backdrop, especially in the evening when the lights come on. In my visit, I enjoyed sipping coffee while listening to live music, then exploring the market stalls for souvenirs and handmade goods. It's a perfect place to spend a relaxed afternoon or an atmospheric evening, whether you're here to shop, eat, or just soak in the atmosphere.

places.address: 1-1, One, 1-5 Nimmanahaeminda Road, ‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏á Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Central Festival is a large mall located on the east side of Chiang Mai, just past the bus terminals 2/3. It offers a wide range of options for both tourists and locals, including numerous food choices and a cinema. The layout is similar to other malls in the area but larger in scale. Visitors can enjoy various restaurants and clothing stores, as well as department store specials. The staff are known for their kindness and friendliness, providing assistance with shopping needs.

sources.snippet: The obvious one is Central Festival, located directly on the super highway, north of the old city. There are a lot of little muubans and condo buildings around this mall.
sources.shortName: How to choose the best location for your future home in Chiang Mai city?

places.name: Central Chiangmai

reviews.text:
A nice mall.
Definitely It is not a small shooing Centre but not too large mall,  just right,  and it has everything.
It ranked as no 7th largest mall in Thailand.

A one stop shopping kind of mall... good brand are available including Jim Thompson ..

They have supermarket and food bazaar / food courts at the loee ground level .. we enjoyed the food and durian .. as well as lot of local snacks to bring home

It has KFC too on the ground floor just at the entrance

The taxi waiting both is very comfortable... they set it up nicely

A big shopping mall. Much bigger that Central Airport Plaza. Several high-end shops and designer stores also. We were there a few days ago and it was packed with Christmas / Holiday Season shoppers. They do have plenty of parking spaces in the parking garage. The stores were pretty busy and staff were helpful.

Central Chiang Mai is a nice place to shop. It's like a Thai street market that meets a Western mall. They've got everything from big-name international stores to cute little Thai shops, so you're bound to find something you like. The mall itself is super clean and easy to walk around, which is a big plus. Honestly, the food here is the real star. You can grab anything you're in the mood for, whether it's fancy international stuff or some tasty Thai food. There are tons of places to eat, from quick bites to sit-down restaurants ‚Äì something for every budget, too.
The only thing is, apart from the food, some of the other stores can be pricey. Still, overall, Central Chiang Mai is a top-notch spot to hang out for an afternoon or evening. You can shop, eat, and have a good time all in one.

places.address: 99, 99/1 -99/2 ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà 4 Lampang - Chiang Mai Superhighway, Fa Ham, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Maya Lifestyle Shopping Center is a luxurious shopping destination in Chiang Mai, owned by the MBK group. This six-floor mega mall offers a wide array of boutiques, gift shops, eateries, and entertainment options. Visitors can explore international brands like Lacoste and Adidas as well as unique Thai shopping outlets such as Jaspal and Panpuri.

sources.snippet: Maya lifestyle shopping mall is a beautifully structured place with six floors housing many stores by various brands. Whether you are a fashion freak, a gadget lover, movie buff, or a foodie, you will find everything here under a single roof. The products that you will come across is a mixture of Thai brands and international brands.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Of course, we cannot go through this part of the guide without mentioning Maya and Kad Suan Kaew, but houses in these areas are hard to find, and even harder to buy.
sources.shortName: How to choose the best location for your future home in Chiang Mai city?

places.name: MAYA Lifestyle Shopping Center

reviews.text: Beautiful Maya shopping mall!  Haven when outside is heated!  Very nice place to cool down for lunch or dinner. Excellent food court and grocery shopping.  We totally enjoyed this mall!

Maya Lifestyle Shopping Center in Chiang Mai is a modern and clean destination that's perfect for tourists. While it may not offer anything particularly unique, it's a great place to spend the day shopping, dining, and relaxing.

The view from the roof is stunning and definitely worth a visit. The coworking space is a great amenity for those looking to get some work done.

The shopping center features multiple floors of high-end shops, a spa, and several restaurants. You can enjoyed trying some local flavors, like the chicken sausage biscuit from the deli, and indulging in a Blizzard from Dairy Queen.

Overall, Maya is a great option for those looking for a comfortable and convenient shopping experience in Chiang Mai. While it may not be a must-visit destination, it's definitely worth stopping by for a day of shopping and dining.

Don't miss the view from the roof!
Take advantage of the coworking space if you need to get some work done.
- Try some of the local flavors at the restaurants and cafes.
- Be prepared for a more touristy experience.

Maya Lifestyle Shopping Center is one of the best modern malls in Chiang Mai, offering a perfect mix of shopping, dining, and entertainment. The mall is clean, spacious, and well-organized, with a great variety of international brands, local boutiques, and specialty stores. The food options are fantastic - from Thai street food at the basement food court to trendy caf√©s and international restaurants. I especially love the rooftop area, which offers beautiful city views, especially in the evening. The cinema here is top-notch, and there are plenty of events and pop-up markets happening regularly. Conveniently located near the Nimman area, it's an ideal place to shop, relax, and enjoy some air-conditioned comfort in the city.

places.address: 55, 5 Huay Kaew Rd, Chang Phueak, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Ploen Ruedee Night Market is a vibrant and lively destination in Chiang Mai that promises an unforgettable evening for food lovers and entertainment seekers alike. This bustling night bazaar features a spacious seating area where visitors can indulge in an array of street food, from traditional Thai dishes to international flavors. Adventurous eaters might even try some local delicacies like fried insects! The atmosphere is enhanced by live music performances, creating the perfect backdrop for enjoying delicious meals with friends or family.

sources.snippet: The Ploen Ruedee Night Market is an excellent destination for eating and shopping in Chiang Mai. It‚Äôs set up like a food park where dozens of stalls and vendors serve up mouth-watering local and international...

places.name: Ploen Ruedee Night Market

reviews.text:
PhaPleon Night Market is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to dive into the lively atmosphere of local culture. The market is filled with an array of food stalls, offering something for everyone. Whether you're craving traditional dishes or something more adventurous, you'll find it here.

What I appreciated most was the ample seating available throughout the market, making it easy to sit down, relax, and enjoy your meal while taking in the vibrant surroundings. The live music adds to the ambiance, creating a festive atmosphere that makes the evening even more enjoyable.

In addition to the food, there are several stalls selling handcrafted souvenirs, perfect for picking up a few unique keepsakes. And if you're in need of some relaxation, you can even grab a massage right there at the market.

Overall, PhaPleon Night Market offers a well-rounded experience with delicious food, live entertainment, and a chance to shop for unique items-all in one place. It's a great spot to spend an evening soaking up the local culture.

At night, the market opens with many many vendors on the sidewalks on both sides of the streets, that feels like there is no end.

Great place to shop for souvenirs, clothes, and accessories.  A lot of western food also available. Local food is priced slightly more than at markets that cater to locals. Based on my one visit, this night market is mostly frequented by tourists.

The old and very popular 'Ploen Ruedee Night Market,' located on Chang Klan Road, has had a big makeover,¬† It is still basically an open-air eating area with a range of food stalls, but it is now called 'Phaploen Market' and has been almost completely revamped.¬† It's a great location and can't really fail.

It still offers a stage for regular nightly entertainment, a variety of varied seating areas and now there is even a new structure offering cocktails on a second level, with fine views of the surroundings.

This week's been wet and grey with few tourists so it was pretty empty when I took a look, but I'm sure it will be as popular as before during the high season.

places.address: 28/3-4 Changklan Rd, Tambon Chang Moi, ‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏á, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Chiang Mai, Ruamchok Mall is a vibrant shopping destination that offers a delightful blend of local and international flavors. This covered mall features a spacious Tops supermarket alongside an adjacent local market brimming with fresh fruits and vegetables. Visitors can explore various food stalls, clothing vendors, and even enjoy drinks at nearby bars. The underground parking makes it convenient for shoppers to access this bustling hub.

sources.snippet: It is a mall which offers anything that you wish to buy; it has Tops supermarket, Rimping and several other stores with products by both local and international brands. Whether you are looking for a pharmacy store or clothes shop, you will find it all here. This place is a haven for foodies with numerous tasty dishes to indulge in and counters by internationally known food brands such as KFC, Pizza Hut, and McDonald‚Äôs.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

places.name: Ruamchok Mall

reviews.text:
Has been a while since my previous visit, a lot of new additions, pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the fresh produce market. Great selection of things, clean, extremely polite and friendly vendors, had a great experience!

Also quite enjoyable were the food stalls and vendors outside the market, along the footpath, offering so many delicacies, snacks, and many tasty things to try.

Good fun!

We came in November 2024:
Enjoyed the night market. It's a small one. There are foods, fruits and vegetables for sales. The soya bean milk drink and dough fritters are yummy üòã Car parking is free. There's enough parking spaces when we arrived at 530PM.

Date of Visit: August 23rd

I visited through a cooking class tour. It looked like a traditional market in Chiang Mai. Since it's used by locals, the prices are very affordable. It would be a good idea to buy some fruit here.

places.address: 204 Fhaham, Fa Ham, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Chiang Mai Night Bazaar is a lively market in Thailand's northern capital, offering a wide array of experiences. The historic center is surrounded by monasteries and temples, with accommodations ranging from traditional homes to modern city hotels. The night bazaar, open from 18:00 to 22:30 daily, features an extensive collection of stalls and shops selling local crafts, souvenirs, street food, clothing, electronics and more.

sources.snippet: Everything and anything made around the Chiang Mai region can be found after 17:00 on Chang Klan Road and the surrounding streets. There are t-shirts, silk scarves, carved soap, lamps, fake football tops, scented oils, sweet candies, wooden carvings and more. On the ground floor of the covered Night Bazaar building itself are local painters and sketch artists who do portraits for reasonable fees.
sources.siteName: Chiang Mai Thailand Travel Guide - 1Stop Chiang Mai
sources.shortName: Guide to Markets and Malls in Chiang Mai - Chiang Mai Thailand Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Chaing Mai Night Bazaar is the most famous market in Chiang Mai, and one of the top tourist attraction in the city. It offers a great shopping experience.

places.name: Chiang Mai Night Bazaar

reviews.text: The businesses and folk of Thailand really know how to do their night bazaars. A popular event in each of their places, these events are carefully attended to details that attract both the locals and visitors. An incredibly huge amount of work that goes into setting up the events. Involving the necessary infrastructure of tents and tables for the displays, and then the huge variety of goods. The range is exceptional and one is spoilt for choice. Freshly prepared food is definitely a highlight and the pricing is affordable even for the locals. Clothing and other accessories too are easily available and also very affordable. This is definitely a model and pattern that can be copied the world over and many of the poorer countries could benefit from such ventures. A must experience for everyone.

Vibrant, cheerful, colourful - everything you can expect from a tourist staple. The souvenirs  ard overpriced, so do haggle.  There are a lot of food options, bit stick to the traditional items - noodles, fried chicken, banh mis .

A fun filled night bazaar that has food, games and cheap stuff to buy. Be ready to bargain, never take the first price. Best to bring cash as some vendors don't prefer credit (costs them a %)
My favorite was the potstickers or fried dumplings, however you may call them in your part of the world.

places.address: Changklan Rd, Chang Moi Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Malin Plaza, also known as Kad Na Mor Market, is a lively night market situated near Chiang Mai University. It's a popular spot among college students and young locals, drawing in crowds every evening. The market offers a variety of goods including apparel, souvenirs, and food stalls under a covered roof. Located about one kilometer west of Nimman Road, it provides a different vibe compared to the touristy night markets in the old city.

sources.snippet: The Malin Plaza market is one of the best markets in Chiang Mai. Although the city already has the famous Walking Street markets and many others, this one is still worth visiting especially if you‚Äôre on a budget...

places.name: Malin Plaza

reviews.text: Huge selection of delicious Thai food. Come and be full.

The university night market opposite Chiang Mai University is actually a gathering place for middle school and university students after school. The quality of the clothes and food there is really quite cheap. The clothes and shoes, in particular, are very suitable for students' styles, but the material quality is not very good. The whole night market is quite large.

As a tourist, I think it's okay to visit if you have time, but don't expect to find good quality clothes. If you're short on time, there's no need to make a special trip to visit.

Such a great night market, and pretty unknown to foreigners. Most of the people visiting are Thai teenagers as it is located nearby a university.

Food is cheap and great! And plenty of clothing shops here at reasonable prices. Cool stuff!

places.generalDescription: Icon IT Chiang Mai, located on Manee Nopparat Soi 3, is a renowned computer center in northern Thailand. It's a comprehensive destination for all IT and gadget requirements. The first floor houses various shops offering electronic spares, hard drives, USBs, security cameras, gaming laptops and accessories. While parking can be challenging for cars, it's recommended to visit by motorcycle. The center also offers home appliances and computer parts at reasonable prices.

sources.snippet: An IT mall, this mall is dedicated to electronics and gadgets, making it a paradise for all IT lovers. Whether you want to get your phone repaired or purchase a screen card, you will get all your phone-related problems solved here. It has marked a niche in the market regarding CCTV cameras.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Icon IT Chiang Mai is often referred to as the number one computer centre in northern Thailand. It‚Äôs a one-stop-shop for all your IT and gadget needs ‚Äì located on Manee Nopparat Soi 3 (north of the moat)...

places.name: Icon IT Chiangmai

reviews.text: Nice IT focused mall, I stopped by here to grab a USB charger for my phone and got a great deal.

We were at this shopping center looking for security cameras. This center has several shops, mainly on the first floor (the second floor does not have that many shops), selling electronic spares, hard drives, USBs, security cameras, etc. Please look at the pictures for more details.

Average place to get computer parts or fixing it. Small but you can get results, not for photo enthusiast, aiming to computer people. Restrooms are on the second floor. Worthy of 30 min tops. Prices are reasonable.

places.address: 29 ‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô ‡∏´‡∏±‡∏™‡∏î‡∏¥‡πÄ‡∏™‡∏ß‡∏µ, Tambon Si Phum, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant Fa Ham area of Chiang Mai, Meechok Plaza is a delightful shopping destination that caters to both locals and visitors alike. This no-frills shopping center features an array of small outlets, local food stalls, and a well-stocked supermarket, making it your go-to spot for everyday essentials. Whether you're on the hunt for fresh vegetables or quality meats, you'll find everything you need here.

sources.snippet: Meechok Plaza is a shopping mall in Chiang Mai where travelers can shop as much as they want without worrying about spending off the entire converted currency slot they have, as it has a Bangkok Bank branch where you can easily communicate in English and get more money converted. It has a a Rimping supermarket where you will find a wide range of groceries. Parlors offer the best services at a low price.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Shopping Malls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: The Meechok Plaza is a shopping mall located in the Fa Ham area of Chiang Mai. This mall is a one-stop-shop for the needs of both locals and tourists, as it boasts of dozens of markets and shops, as well as essential...

places.name: Meechok Plaza Chiangmai

reviews.text: Nice shopping mall in faham. Has all the regular shops like rimping, wine connection etc... they have a market there as well I think on Wednesday
I like shopping in Rimping. My in law loves street market around the area where she buys pretty ready to wear clothes for her kids.

I love Meechok Plaza and its neighbouring Ruam Chok Mall.
There is so much to choose from.
Starting with the fresh market behind Ruam Chok, to the Tops supermarket, skin care clinics, cafes, Rimping Supermarket,  optical, healthfood shop, to your American food groups KFC, Pizza Hut, McDonald's and Starbucks.

There is something for everyone

places.address: 206, Fa Ham, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Anusarn Market is a vibrant traditional market located at the end of Chiang Mai Night Bazaar. It offers an array of souvenir and food stalls, as well as nightly cabaret shows for entertainment. Visitors can explore rows of stalls selling local Thai products and enjoy affordable massages and fish spa treatments for relaxation. The market also features live performances, making it a haven for art lovers. Additionally, there are various restaurants and venues where visitors can unwind with a cold beer or cocktail.

sources.snippet: Anusan Market holds special meaning for travellers keen on experiencing the charm of Thailand in a unique and homely space such as this one.

places.name: Anusarn Market

reviews.text: A tremendous range of street food. Quite enjoyed the vibe of the place. I went late in the afternoon, place was still filling up. Clothes, souvenirs, handicrafts - all there as well!

Anusran Market in Chiang Mai is a bustling local market that offers a wide variety of Thai and Western food at very affordable prices. While it's a decent spot for budget-friendly meals, the overall experience is a mixed bag-good for quick bites but lacking in some areas that prevent it from being a standout destination.

One of the market's biggest strengths is its diverse food selection. You'll find classic Thai street food like pad Thai, som tam (spicy papaya salad), grilled meats, and noodle soups, alongside Western options such as burgers, sandwiches, and pizza. The prices are very reasonable, making it a great place for travelers on a budget.

Anusran Market is a typical local market-lively, chaotic, and not the most comfortable for a relaxed meal. The seating areas are basic, often cramped, and not always clean. If you're looking for a quiet dining experience, this isn't the place.

The affordability of Anusran Market is its biggest selling point. You can easily get a filling meal for under 100 THB ($3), which is great for backpackers or those looking to save money. However, the low prices sometimes reflect in the quality-portions can be small, and ingredients aren't always the freshest.

Anusran Market is a solid option if you're looking for cheap, varied food in Chiang Mai. It's convenient, especially if you're staying nearby, and offers enough choices to satisfy different tastes. However, it doesn't stand out in terms of food quality, ambiance, or cleanliness compared to other markets like Warorot or the North Gate Jazz Co-op area.

*Pros:*
‚úî Affordable prices
‚úî Wide variety of Thai and Western food
‚úî Authentic local market experience

*Cons:*
‚úñ Inconsistent food quality
‚úñ Crowded and noisy
‚úñ Hygiene could be improved

If you're in the area and want a quick, cheap meal, Anusran Market is worth a stop. But if you're looking for the best street food in Chiang Mai, there are better options elsewhere.

Lots of food, beverages, arts, crafts and clothes on show here. It is quite a bustling night market, with traditional dance performances in the food court area. It also maintains a chill vibe and so glad I decided to check it out. Highly recommended place to visit.

places.address: 149 Changklan Rd, Chang Khlan Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand
